body.name: The Many Deaths of Laila Starr
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review "A fantastic premise, heady ideas, and absorbing art" ― Entertainment Weekly"Wonderful magical realist tale" ― Variety About the Author Ram V. is an award winning author and creator of comics & graphic novels such as Grafity’s Wall, These Savage Shores, & Blue in Green. Since publishing his first book in 2016, Ram’s work has gone on to garner critical and popular success and multiple awards. Apart from creating original work, since 2018 Ram has also written for iconic characters & titles at DC Comics and Marvel. Filipe Andrade is an artist from Lisbon, Portugal. He has collaborated and published with BOOM! Studios, Marvel, MTV Networks, Riot Games, and more. The Many Deaths of Laila Starr comic series launched as Ram V.’s highest selling original series in his career by 200+%.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 13 hrs 26 mins
body.description: Humanity is on the verge of discovering immortality, which means the avatar of Death is out of a job… or is she?Humanity is on the verge of discovering immortality. As a result, the avatar of Death is cast down to Earth to live a mortal life in Mumbai as twenty-something Laila Starr. Struggling with her newfound mortality, Laila has found a way to be placed in the time and place where the creator of immortality will be born. Will Laila take her chance to stop mankind from permanently altering the cycle of life, or will death really become a thing of the past? A powerful new graphic novel from award-winning writer Ram V (These Savage Shores, Swamp Thing) and Filipe Andrade (Captain Marvel) that explores the fine line between living and dying through the lens of magical realism. Collects The Many Deaths of Laila Starr #1-5.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thanks for the journey
reviews.reviewText: Beautiful art paired with a beautiful story. Love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Engaging story with post-psychedelic colors over stylized art. This is a gem of a graphic novel. The story is beautifully moving and creates space for existential contemplation. A moving and emotional ride. Strongly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this illustrator
reviews.reviewText: I was after this comic for awhile—finally purchased it. I’m a fan of the illustrator so that is the initial reason I bought it. Good price for all of the combined comics into 1.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Complex yet stunningly simple in the best way. The art and story complement each other perfectly creating an ethereal vibe. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Art and Great Story
reviews.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed the art and story here. Great and unexpected story, great character growth. I wasn't entirely satisfied with the ending, but overall I think it totally deserved to be an Eisner nominee. Great graphic noval all around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finished this in one night
reviews.reviewText: The story and the artwork are both breathtaking and I couldn't put it down. My one complaint is that I wanted it to be longer, I was not ready for it to be done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was a great story to show life and death are important, beautiful, and amazing. This might be the best description of life to show a child life without scaring them. Depending on age and maturity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great graphic novel with story in India
reviews.reviewText: I really love this intriguing setting of the godness becoming a human and struggling to find the meaning of the life. Beautiful drawing and insightful story.

Ótima história...Nada a reclamar da edição, apenas reclamarei da embalagem que durante todo o ano, a Amazon tem enviado as HQs nacionais e importadas (as importadas não estão vindo lacradas, parecem usadas ou devolvidas, só pra mencionar) em envelopes plásticos ou de papel, só porque são forrados com plástico bolha, eles pensam que protegem as edições. Já recebi até edições quebradas ao meio. Nunca devolvi tantos pedidos como nesse ano.

I haven't read much by Ram V in the past, but I gave this one a try. It is an excellent read steeped in Indian culture. The characters are fascinating and well developed. The writing is ponderous and well paced. The arch is gorgeous and dreamlike. Also, the hard cover edition looks amazing on my bookshelf.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great art, beautiful colors, interesting story!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Arrived on time inside a simple Amazon plastic bag, but surprisingly it came in good condition...
One of the top 5(of many hundreds ) comic stories I have ever read, in all my years reading comics,since 1987.
gostei bastante da história e dos gráficos, bom que a história é completa nessa edição
